newsitem.title: USA: Rubbermaid Q3 EPS seen like year-ago's.
newsitem.headline: Rubbermaid Q3 EPS seen like year-ago's.

text.p: Rubbermaid Inc said on Wednesday it expected its third-quarter net sales and earnings per share to be comparable with the level of a year ago.
In the year-ago period, Rubbermaid earned $0.32 per share, or $50.3 million on net sales of $641.5 million.

Continued category softness in the sales of large, outdoor juvenile products will offset volume gains in other parts of the company. Expected profitability improvements from higher productivity will be offset by the lower volume and by recent rapid increases in plastic resin material costs.
"Our two-year realignment program is on track with its targeted improvements," said chairman and chief executive Wolfgang Schmitt.

"Despite significant gains in lowering our cost structure, higher costs for resin and lower-than-expected unit volume will prevent us from continuing to attain the growth in profitability we had been expecting this year."
